page.title: 08HOUSING
page.content: There are more new than old houses in the village of Kingswood. The new houses seem to be smaller than the old ones, though some of them are small terraced cottages. Most of the old houses, which are three storeys high are around the old Abbey Gateway in the middle of the Village. There are no thatched houses in Kingswood. All the houses are made of brick or stone and have tiled or slate roofs. There are a few bungalows on the main road out of Kingswood. Most of the houses in the village are different from one another, except on the two estates: the council estate and a new private estate. The newest housing estate was started in 1980 and some of the houses are still being built. There are not many houses in Kingswood which are not lived in.
